com.communote.server.core.vo.user.preferences

Class UserPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.vo.user.preferences.UserPreference
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UserInterfaceUserPreference

    public abstract class UserPreference
extends Object
    Abstract class, all concrete user preferences should implement.

    Note: Implementing class must have an empty constructor to allow instantiation while runtime.

    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaults

        protected Map<String,String> getDefaults()
        Return the default values of this preference as a map. This implementation returns an empty map.
        Returns:
        Map containing default values. The return value must not be null.

      • getPreferences

        public Map<String,String> getPreferences()
        Returns:
        The preferences as map.

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue(String key,
                        boolean defaultValue)
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        defaultValue - The default value to return.
        Returns:
        The value as boolean (false, when empty).

      • getValueFromJson

        public <T> T getValueFromJson(String key,
                              T defaultValue,
                              Class<T> type)
        Method to get a more complex object from a JSON string.

        Note, that parsing is done on every request you do, so this might be slow on large objects. Also all parsing exceptions are logged and not thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the object.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        defaultValue - The default value.
        type - The type of the object.
        Returns:
        The object itself.

      • setPreferences

        public void setPreferences(Map<String,String> preferences)
        Method to set the preferences.
        Parameters:
        preferences - The preferences to set. These might overwrite existing ones.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(String key,
                     Object value)
        Method to set the given object as value. Use this only, if the object is some kind of primitive type and can easily be restored from a simple String.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        value - The value to set. Use null to remove the value.

      • setValueToJson

        public void setValueToJson(String key,
                           Object value)
        Method to set a more complex object explicitly as JSON.

        Note, that parsing is done on every request you do, so this might be slow on large objects. Also all parsing exceptions are logged and not thrown.

        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        value - The value to be set, if null, the key will be removed.
